title: English Magpie pigeon
text: The English Magpie is a <a href="breed">breed</a> of <a href="fancy%20pigeon">fancy pigeon</a> developed over many years of <a href="selective%20breeding">selective breeding</a>. They can also be very easily spotted in England and in most parts of <a href="America">America</a>. Magpies, along with other varieties of <a href="Domestic%20pigeon">domesticated pigeons</a>, are all descendants from the <a href="rock%20pigeon">rock pigeon</a> ("Columba livia"). The original Magpie was one of the old tumbler varieties, coming via <a href="Germany">Germany</a> from <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a> about 1900.
